alert.note: Alert for Dimmit; Edwards; Frio; Kinney; Maverick; Real; Uvalde; Val Verde; Zavala (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued March 22 at 2:24AM CDT until March 22 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...CRITICAL FIRE WEATHER CONDITIONS WEST OF A LINE FROM ROCKSPRINGS TO SABINAL TO PEARSALL TODAY... .Expect northwest winds of 20 to 25 mph with gusts to 35 mph Today. Minimum humidities of 15 to 20 percent are also expected. As a result, a Red Flag Warning has been issued for rapid and erratic wildfire behavior. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 7 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR THE RIO GRANDE PLAINS AND EDWARDS PLATEAU... The National Weather Service in Austin/San Antonio has issued a Red Flag Warning for gusty winds and low relative humidity, which is in effect from 1 PM this afternoon to 7 PM CDT this evening. * WINDS...Northwest 20 to 25 mph with gusts up to 35 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 19 percent. * IMPACTS...Any wildfires ignited may spread rapidly and unpredictably. Prevention of fire starts by avoiding planned burning, or by limiting activities prone to produce sparks can stop the start and spread of wildfires.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now....or will shortly. A combination of strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.
